sentences.sContent: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.sCn: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

sentences.sContent: ...she says the results still suggest women in geoscience are at a potential disadvantage from the very beginning of their careers starting with those less than out-standing letters of recommendation...
...Unemployed boomers are at a disadvantage in job-hunting because employers tend to hire younger workers...
...This has often left me feeling at a disadvantage and wondering why I bothered doing so in the first place...

words.tran: 贫困的；处于不利地位的；社会地位低下的
使处于不利地位（disadvantage的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective
